title: In which order are Immanuel Kant's books meant to be read? - Quora

response.answer_text: Here is the order in which the major works were written. Jump ahead to the Critique of Pure Reason, 2d edition, but consider it first. I’d follow the order of publishing otherwise. (1781) First edition of the Critique of Pure Reason[175] (Kritik der reinen Vernunft)[176](1783) Prolegomena to any Future Metaphysics (Prolegomena zu einer jeden künftigen Metaphysik)(1784) "An Answer to the Question: What Is Enlightenment?" ("Beantwortung der Frage: Was ist Aufklärung?")[177](1785) Groundwork of the Metaphysics of Morals (Grundlegung zur Metaphysik der Sitten)(1787) Second edition of the Critique of Pure Reason[178] (Kritik der reinen Vernunft)[179](1788) Critique of Practical Reason (Kritik der praktischen Vernunft)[180](1790) Critique of Judgment (Kritik der Urteilskraft)[181]

There is no order intended by Kant. Since 1781 there are several changes in his ideas, why for example two more Critiques became necessary. His book on religion (1793) had a huge impact on the ideas of German Idealism. If it’s is your interest, start reading here. This book is also important for his ethics, for it places Kantian ethical rigor in its perspective.
